Editorial Reviews

Review

The allegations Larry Sinclair makes in this book about our current president should be sending shock-waves through our national media. Consider that on November 6 & 7, 1999 Sinclair claims that he engaged in homosexual acts with then-Illinois Senator Barack Obama, who during these trysts not only procured cocaine for the author, but also smoked crack cocaine while being fellated. Although relatively unknown outside his home state at the time, Obama hit the national stage in 2004 by delivering a keynote speech at the Democratic National Convention. Sinclair realized only then that he'd engaged in sex with an up-and-coming political superstar.

After hearing what he perceived to be blatant lies about Obama's sexuality and drug use, Sinclair uploaded an infamous YouTube video, made a television appearance in Puerto Rico, and addressed the National Press Club in Washington, DC. As a result, he describes how Senior Advisor David Axelrod spearheaded a vindictive smear campaign against him, while Senator Joe Biden and his son Beau arranged for his arrest after the NPC speech. Even more incriminating, Sinclair writes about his concerns that Obama and Reverend Jeremiah Wright were involved in the murder of Obama's former lover, choirmaster Donald Young.

Whether you agree with him or not, Larry Sinclair's book is an authentic page-turner, one that I completed in a single sitting. In an age where political correctness reigns supreme, it's refreshing to read an expose that lays all its chips on the table, regardless of the ramifications.

Victor Thorn author, Hillary (and Bill): The Sex Volume --Victor Thorn, Author Hillary (and Bill): The Sex Volume November 30, 2009

"A shocking expose of an American President that makes Bill Clinton, and/or the rumors about John F. Kennedy seem minor by comparison."

Review by K. Kenny --K Kenny, October 4, 2009

I have just finished reading a book written by Lawrence W. Sinclair which title is: BARACK OBAMA & LARRY SINCLAIR: Cocaine, Sex, Lies & MURDER?

As to the content: The author wrote his book under the most trying of circumstances including threats on his life and his family's lives. The lies that have been told about him, by Obama supporters, among people in high places, in government and the news media only attest to one thing; THE BOOK IS TOTALLY NON-FICTION.

Plato (the philosopher) once pointed out that truth has a certain ring to it; Sinclair's book, without a doubt, proves Plato's point. The 'ring of truth' in his (Larry's) book is loud and clear.

If you would like to learn of the depth politicians will go to amass power -- if you would like to learn of just a few of the 'deals' politicians make with the devil, get a copy of Sinclair's book. It will disgust you -- it will make you want to vomit -- it will make you angry as hell. Above all, it will make you realize "...this isn't Kansas, Toto." It is beyond belief that Mr. Sinclair was able to even publish his book, let alone have it printed.

Two things are for sure: 1) After reading it you will know what type of hoodlum resides at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue and 2) Although Larry Sinclair is an admitted gay person, he is more of a 'man' than 99 percent of the politicians in Washington. --Joe7000 Good Reads.com, July 24, 2009

Virtually everyone has heard about Larry Sinclair and his allegations regarding a couple of days he spent with Barack Obama in Chicago in 1999. After a highly orchestrated whitewashing by the mainstream media of the story, and after being blackballed by every single book publisher he contacted regarding the publication of his story, Larry Sinclair decided to start his own publishing company, and this is the first book from Sinclair Publishing.

Obama's silence on Sinclair's allegations is deafening. It speaks volumes about what likely happened in Chicago back on November 6 and 7, 1999. And although I was not there to witness the events, it sounds like, judging from the consistency of Sinclair's story over a year and a half, and the fine details he provides in the book, that Sinclair is in fact telling the truth. It appears that indeed Obama was leading a life as a closeted bisexual at least through 1999. Oh, and of course, he also seemed to have been fudging the truth regarding his drug use since, especially since college... --Chirpy Rumblings, October 24, 2009

From the Publisher

The biggest untold story of the 2008 U.S. Presidential Election... Finally, the no-holds-barred, 100% true story of Barack Obama's use and sale of cocaine; his homosexual affairs and the December 23, 2007 murder of Barack Obama's former lover and choir director of Obama's Chicago church of 20 years, Donald Young, just days before the 2008 Iowa Caucus. This searing candid story begins with Barack Obama meeting Larry Sinclair in November, 1999, and subsequently procuring and selling cocaine, and then engaging in consensual, homosexual sex with Sinclair on November 6th and again on November 7, 1999. You'll read in riveting detail how Sinclair, in 2007, repeatedly contacted and requested that the Obama campaign simply come clean about their candidate's 1999 drug use and sales. You learn how the Obama campaign, David Axelrod and Barack Obama used Donald Young (the homosexual lover of Barack Obama) to contact and seek out information from Sinclair about who he had told of Obama's crimes and actions. You'll read how the Obama campaign used internet porn king Dan Parisi and Ph.D. fraud Edward I. Gelb to conduct a rigged polygraph exam in an attempt to make the Sinclair story go away. The Obama team and the controlled media - specifically MSNBC's Chris Matthews, Keith Olbermann, the New York Times, CNN, Politico's Ben Smith, The DailyKos, The Huffington Post and others - attacked the National Press Club for making its facilities available to Larry Sinclair for a news conference to present his evidence and allegations to the world media. You'll read how Vice President Joe Biden's son, Delaware Attorney General Beau Biden, issued an arrest warrant on completely false, fabricated charges to attempt to discredit Mr. Sinclair's National Press Club news conference. This is a staggeringly true story of how the sitting U.S.President with the help of the Mainstream Media, the Chicago Police Department, the FBI, the Delaware Attorney General and others got away with murder and more....

From the Author

Anyone who is interested in the truth about Barack Obama should read this book. The truth is something Barack Obama and the Obama White House do not want to talk about.

See how far Barack Obama, Joe Biden, and the Democrats went to keep the truth about Barack Obama's drug history and homosexual relationships out of the news.

From the Inside Flap

Presidential Campaign 2008:lies, sex, drugs & murder...all the makings of a good suspense novel. But in the 2008 Presidential campaign, there was far more happening,and unlike a novel, it was true. The mainstream media decided to anoint Barack Obama the next President of the United States; and in doing so, they chose to ignore their role to vet the candidates, for good and bad.

Barack Obama acknowledged his drug usage in his college years, but his statements caught the ear of someone who had actually shared drugs with the candidate a few years earlier when he was an Illinois State Senator. As his campaign tried to ignore the requests by Larry Sinclair to acknowledge the discrepancies in his story,the Obama machine went into full gear...threats, intimidation, computer hacking, abuse of power, political paybacks, all in the attempts to silence Larry Sinclair.

About the Author

Lawrence W. Sinclair was born September 26, 1961 in Camden, South Carolina. The third of four children, Lawrence was an independent minded individual from a very young age.

Today Lawrence Sinclair resides in Port Orange, Florida and is currently running for U.S. Congress in Florida District 24 in the 2010 general election as an Independent.

Lawrence Sinclair is currently working on a follow up to his first book; Barack Obama & Larry Sinclair: Cocaine, Sex, Lies & Murder? after publishing a first novel for Thornton Parsons on September 1, 2009, Go Tell Aunt Rhody: Southern Murder X2.

1 Star
No proof...No Credibility
This book, which offers no evidence at all that a meeting between then State Senator Barack Obama, (who happened to be in a high profile race for the Democratic Congressional seat for his district against Bobby Rush,) and Sinclair ever took place, as the author has claimed. Its based on the author's word alone, absent any RELIABLE documentation, physical proof and or corroboration from the Limo Driver, Bartender at the "Upscale" Lounge, Hotel Clerk, etc., that the events as described by Sinclair in his book, ever took place. The "book" begins with a dedication In memory of Donald Young. In his "dedication" Sinclair claims that Donald Young died "for no other reason than to protect the image of Barack Obama." He also claims that Young's untimely death prevented the world from knowing that Barack Obama was a closet homosexual. The problem with Sinclair's declaration, (as with everything about the "book") is simply a matter of lack of evidence for his allegations and a lot of blustering. Sinclair's "book" is designed to appease those who have followed and believed Sinclair these past 18 months, as well as those who simply cannot stand Obama and would like to see ANYTHING take him down. Inside the book, we are treated to an `Introduction' which spews more declarative statements without evidence. With the exception of the first chapter, which covers Sinclair's "criminal years" (according to Sinclair), the entire book is filled with diatribes, innuendos and unsubstantiated narratives. This tiny little "book" pretends to be the GREAT work of a GREAT up and coming author, at least according to Sinclair supporters. The fact is, it's a self published piece of drivel that only his supporters will buy. I will concede I purchased this piece of trash because Sinclair had something to say about me in his book. Needless to say, I have covered how I feel about that in previous posts. Barack Obama & Larry Sinclair: Cocaine, Sex Lies & Murder? Is nothing more than a piece of drivel scripted by a con man and his enablers. Its a poorly written narrative about an eternal victim, by that eternal victim, to elicit sympathy, support and anger. What bothers me is that none of his supporters have ever asked for or required proof of what Sinclair has been saying for the last 18 months. Sinclair has filled 40% of his book with letters and documents that can be found on his old sites. The "book" is 50% filled with rehashed garbage, accusations and "they keep threatening me" screed that can also be found on Sinclair's various blogs. The last 10% of the book is fodder for his lemmings. Something to make them buy the book and to pass the word around. It contains a chapter on "The Hillary Connection" and allegedly "names names" and provides telephone numbers (for what purpose, I don't know.) Of course the other "hook" (no pun intended) is the chapter (more like paragraphs) describing Obama's penis. That "chapter" is entitled "The Physical Description" and is the final chapter in the book. I find it curious that no where in Sinclair's book does one find any mention of an effort on HIS or his enablers' part to search for or obtain evidence that would substantiate his claim. Perhaps if Mr. Sinclair had spent more time in trying to prove his own story instead of digging for dirt on his detractors, there might have been at least an iota of credibility regarding his book.

proto57
4.0 out of 5 stars I Tend Towards Belief in This Account
Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
Verified Purchase
I had of course heard about Mr. Sinclair's claims years ago, and really had not formed an opinion about their veracity. But when the 1982 Obama letter came out, essentially admitting he is either homosexual or bisexual, I became curious to learn more. So I bought the book and read it in about 4 sittings.

First about me, since people would wonder if my positions would affect my opinion on this matter: Yes, I am politically Conservative, but not socially. People often assume that when one believes in political Conservative principles that they automatically must be socially conservative also. This does not always follow, and does not, with me. Even if I don't personally follow any particular lifestyle or habit, it does not mean I am "against" it. And so while I strongly disagree with Obama's politics, I don't give damn about his personal life. If he is a closet homosexual, I mean, I don't care at all, and even fully understand why he would hide this from the public.

That does not mean I like deceit in any politician, and I would not want a drug user in the White House, either, for practical reasons. But homosexuality, or bisexuality alone, I would not and do not care. Now to the reasons I feel Larry Sinclair is probably being truthful about his sexual and drug encounter with Obama:

1) Well, it is now supported by Obama's admission of homosexuality/bisexuality in the 1982 letter. He wrote, "In regard to homosexuality, I must say that I believe this is an attempt to remove oneself from the present, a refusal perhaps to perpetuate the endless farce of earthly life. You see, I make love to men daily, but in the imagination." Well, "imagination" or acted upon, this means he is homosexual. You don't have to eat cherry pie to like crave cherry pie... you are still a cherry pie lover. And admitting it then makes the accuser who said they saw you EATING cherry pie all the more believable, especially since they said so long before we heard your admission.

2) The description of Obama's "junk", with no rebuttal: Everyone involved certainly read this description... O's wife, his ex-girlfriends... and it would have been very easy to close the door on all of Sinclair's claims by simply saying, "I know his junk well, and this description is wrong". Spare me the people saying they would not stoop to that level... no, with an opportunity to discredit this account, such a statement would be the easiest thing to do. But no one did. That is very telling to me. And also, the fact that Larry took the chance of putting this in the book? If he was lying, I don't think he would have ever taken this chance.

3) The fact that Larry's claims are really not that extreme, when he had the opportunity to go large: I mean, if he was lying about this encounter, why not make it more sensational? Like a mutual sexual "catcher/pitcher" set of acts, including a**l? Or even that O performed fellatio on Larry? If you think about it, the claims are really pretty tame... one-way fellatio, two instances. I mean, the low level of claimed interaction strikes me as being real.

4) The complexity, subtlety and detail of the accounts strike me as being real: I personally think it is difficult to invent subtlety when lying. It is harder to do than being extreme. Overall, the account smacks as genuine to me.

5) The serious effort to destroy Sinclair's reputation, what there is of any reputation: The type of response from Obama supporters, much of it easily debunked, and only used with the hope that those who hear it will not do their own research: This is a base political and social tactic which works, and which we have all seen time and time again. But the thing is, and twofold: a) Why did they deem it necessary? There are plenty of bogus claims against many public figures, and when obviously fake, little need is seen to go after the claimant's life and rep, and b) again, they never address the FACTS of his claim accurately: They never show Obama was somewhere else, or that Sinclair was, or that his "junk" looked different than described, and so on and so forth. All the dubunking, I mean, is also debunkable, and they never validly dismiss Sinclair's facts nor timeline.

6) There are other claims of Obama being homosexual/bisexual. Look them up. It is not a case of O being charged with everything under the Sun, such as a Russian spy, or transsexual, or drunk driver, or wife beater, or heterosexual philanderer with affairs, or bipolar, or, or, or... the claims we hear are almost always along the same lines: That he is a closet homosexual/bisexual partaking in affairs with men. Not that there is anything wrong with that, that is between him and his wife, IMHO. But it goes to supporting Larry's claims here.

Now past the sexual and drug encounters, when Sinclair speculates on the cause of death for the homosexual choir director, and the speculated role of both Obama and Wright in this murder, I do not feel that there is near enough evidence to make these charges. But then again, Sinclair does not present this as fact, only as his own speculation. The point of his bringing it up is that he is showing that the authorities didn't properly pursue these leads, and this implies a cover up. I mean, not a cover up of any crime, which may not have even been committed by O and W, but a cover up of associated information, such as a possible sexual relationship between O and this man. THAT is the nut of this, even if O was totally innocent of any murder plot.

So I don't know, and everyone ought to... of course... make up their own mind on this. But I tend to believe the sexual/drug Obama encounter part of this story. I think Larry Sinclair is telling the truth. Read the book and make up your own mind, of course. But that is my two cents.

There are legal situations in this book under the VP and VP DA son initiated where I felt he clearly was being harrassed and victimized. Situations that the reader will see he CLEARLY was the VICTIM. I did question why he pursued some particular things like the polygraph test after "testers" revealed themseleves to be less than trustworthy. It also has underlying reasoning and subtle inferences to the Clinton camp, implications of the sitting VP and his DA son engaging in less that lawfully legal behavior -(won't spoil it for you. Get ready for the grand finale where he describes the Commander-In-Chief's most intimate details regarding masculinity (please excuse my typos- no spell ck here) All in all you do not have to believe every word Mr Sinclair writes but you will have questions about how he came to know so much. After reading the book, examining the few legal docs he included and reading the final chapter nailed it for me. I had been following the murder of the Choir Leader at Reverend Wrights church on my own and there is no investigation into it so I knew that to be absolutly correct. Enjoy the book! It certainly will raise some questions. I would also like to state that the author did not seem hate the presidential candidate, according to him he wanted the country to be aware of his drug use.

John Duddy
5.0 out of 5 stars Cocaine,Sex, Lies & Murder?
Reviewed in Canada on September 14, 2009
Verified Purchase
One could read the book in a day. Larry Sinclair wrote this in haste; there are a few minor editing errors.
And when you are finished you will want to know why this matter did not get cleaned up before Americans went to the polls in November 2008. The author has guts. He states he had a gay frolic with Barack H. Obama complete with illegal drug use more than once. Big problem here; the leader of the "free" world needs to be beyond reproach. We might forgive gay flings and drug use in the next-door neighbors but the President of the United States must not be open to blackmail. Yet Larry Sinclair outlines details of his gay frolics with drugs in 1999 in Chicago with the future President. Larry Sinclair writes that he asked Mr. Obama to make clear that he used drugs when Senator in 1999. Larry writes that the Obama campaign reacted by having a Mr. Young call him probing for information on who Larry talked to. Larry gives names, lists phone numbers and locations. Why would Larry want to have candidate Obama admit to drug use yet not demand an admission of a gay fling? The reason is not obvious.
And then Mr. Young, Donald Young, gay choir director at Obama's Trinity United Church was murdered. Because Mr. Young knew several of Sinclair's phone numbers allegedly known to Mr. Obama, Larry disclosed his activities to the Chicago police expecting an investigation, not a cover-up.
Following a press conference at the National Press Club Larry was arrested. Larry writes that Beau Biden, son of future Vice President Joe Biden conspired to bring an indictment for a crime that never happened.
This from the Foreword by Jeff Rense:-
...as you read this astonishing book, prepare to think of it honestly and logically...for it will
challenge you to do just that. The Larry Sinclair story is utterly unique on the American Political
Landscape. Is it true?...that is for you to decide. One thing I guarantee...you will never forget it.

President Obama has formidable tasks:- steer the ship of state through wars started by others, prevent a financial tsunami, show proof that the Official 9/11 Report is in fact accurate (despite the opinion of scientists, architects, engineers and a big number of world citizens)and get re-elected for a second term. This is daunting without mention of Cocaine,Sex, Lies & Murder. Best wishes to President Barack Obama and to Larry Sinclair, may the truth prevail, may we all survive.
